SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.faul.jql.core
Class Jql

java.lang.Object
  org.faul.jql.core.Jql

public class Jql
extends java.lang.Object

Implements the JSON Query Language for JAVA. This object is heart of the system all entry points into the JSON database are made through this object.

Author:
Ben Faul

Constructor Detail

Jql

public Jql()
Empty constructor. An empty collection is created with name 'defaultTable'.

Jql

public Jql(java.lang.String dbName,
           java.io.FileReader source)
    throws java.lang.Exception
A FileReader constructor for the JQL. Pass it a database name, and the file reader for a data file of JSON data, the constructor instantiates the Jql object with the contents of that file.

Parameters:
dbName. - String - the name to associiate with this database,
source. - FileReader - The filereader object to instantiate JQL from.
Throws:
Exception. - Throws exception on bad JSON.
java.lang.Exception

Jql

public Jql(java.lang.String dbName,
           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> source)
Constructor that creates a JQL parser from a Map. Pass a Map object to the constructor and a database is generated from it by the named database.

Parameters:
source - HashMap. The hashmap you wish to treat as a database.
dbName. - String - the name to associiate with this database,

Jql

public Jql(java.lang.String dbName,
           java.lang.String source)
    throws java.lang.Exception
Create a table from the JSON string. This constructor generates a Jql object from the JSON formatted string.

Parameters:
source - String. The JSON string to convert to a database.
Throws:
Exception. - Throws an exception if the source could not be converted to a Map object.
java.lang.Exception
Method Detail

fromJson

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> fromJson(java.lang.String data)
                                                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Return a linked hashmap object from the JSON formatted data string. The JSON data is stored as a List of Map objects.

Parameters:
data - String. The JSON data to convert.
Returns:
Object Map. The list of hashmaps that represents the object defined in the data parameter.
Throws:
Exception. - Throws exception on badly formed JSON data.
java.lang.Exception

jsqlConvert

public static java.lang.Object jsqlConvert(java.lang.Object source)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
Given an object File::/filename, ArrayList or JSON source, convert to a JSON database or a FileReader. When given a file name, the contents of the file is converted to JSON. If the object parameter is a list of objects, then this is converted into a JSOn database. If the object parameter is a string in JSON format, it will be used to create a JSON database.

Parameters:
source - . The source of the database.
Returns:
Object. The List of Hashmaps that represent the data formed by
Throws:
Exception. - Throws exceptions on i/o errors and badly formed JSON.
java.lang.Exception

toJson

public static java.lang.String toJson(java.lang.Object convert)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
Convert an object of a linked hashmap into a JSON string. Pass the object to this method and will return a the JSON formatted compressed string representation of that object.

Parameters:
convert - Object. The object to convert to a JSON string.
Returns:
String. The string representation of the Object.
Throws:
Exception. - Throws exceptions if the Gson converter could not parse the input string.
java.lang.Exception

toJson

public static java.lang.String toJson(java.lang.Object convert,
                                      boolean pretty)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
Convert an object into a pretty printed JSON string. Pass the object to this method and will return a JSON formatted string representation of that object.

Parameters:
convert - Object. The object to convert to JSON string.
pretty - boolean. Set to true to get pretty output.
Returns:
String. The returned object.
Throws:
Exception. - Throws exception on bad JSON. exceptions on JSON errors.
java.lang.Exception

addDatabase

public void addDatabase(java.lang.String key)
Add an empty database to the database mapping. Creates a new hashmap to represent the new database, stored in the database map.

Parameters:
key - String. The name of the empty database in memory.

obj - Object, A list object, or a JSON formatted List.

Exception. - Throws exceptions if obj is wrong type, or JSON decode error occurs.

closeStoredProcedures

public void closeStoredProcedures()
Set the stored procedure map to null. This will set the stored procedures reference to null. If you want to save the stored procedures to disk, don't call closeProcedure(), keep the stored procedures open, then write the database to disk.

execute

public java.lang.Object execute(java.lang.String sql)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Execute the SQL statements in the string argument. This is where the classical SQL statements are executed, such as selct, delete, insert, etc.

Parameters:
sql - String. The SQL to execute, can be more than one. Each is terminated with ';'.
Returns:
Object. The results of the SQL statements.
Throws:
Exception, - Throws errors on bad JSON format and SQL parse errors.
java.lang.Exception

execute

public java.lang.Object execute(java.lang.String sql,
                                java.lang.Object tableInfo)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Given a textual SQL statement, compile it ad then execute it.

Parameters:
sql - String. One or more SQL statements, each terminated with ';'.
tableInfo - Map. The table name to JAVA object map.
Returns:
Object. The results of the statements as an intermediate table.
Throws:
Exception. - Throws exception on SQL and JSON errors.
java.lang.Exception

Parameters:
z - ZqlParser. The parser to extend.

public java.lang.String toCSV(java.util.List<java.util.Map> list)

toCSV

public java.lang.String toCSV(java.util.List<java.util.Map> list,
                              java.lang.String... tokens)
Convert the given list into a CSV file. Use this form to print only those columns you want, and in the order you want.

Parameters:
list - List. The table map to convert to CSV.
tokens - String []. the column names to output.
Returns:
String. The formatted CSV of the given table.

toCSV

public java.lang.String toCSV(java.lang.String table)

Parameters:
table - String. The name of the table to convert.
Returns:
String. The table's CSV representation.

                              java.lang.String... args)

Parameters:
table - String. The name of the table to convert.
args - String[] args. The columns to convert. Unmentioned keys are ignored.
Returns:
String. The table converted to CSV as a string.
